CHOICE High School
May 19 at 9:24 AM ·

Are you a 6th-11th grade student interested in attending CHOICE next year? Good news! We are now accepting applications for the 20-21 school year! For more information about CHOICE and to apply, visit https://choice.sheltonschools.org/information/applications.
**IMPORTANT: Students interested in attending CHOICE must apply even if they were enrolled in CHOICE last year.

CHOICE is designed to prepare students for the future through relevant and rigorous 21st-century curriculum as they work towards earning a high school diploma. CHOICE provides a safe, supportive educational environment for each student. We will help all students achieve personal and academic success so they can transition to higher education or the workplace, and become informed, productive citizens.

CHOICE will serve about 150 students, grades 7-12, who need a flexible schedule (10 hrs/week – full time) based on their learning needs.

Stadium Lights

Dear Highclimber Community,

The stadium lights will shine on Jack Stark Field at Highclimber Stadium tonight. The lights will honor all the Seniors who lost their seasons, and let you all know we have not forgotten about you. You will always be a Highclimber and this will always be your home. We will miss you, and we can’t wait to see the amazing things you do in the future.

The lights will also be a symbol to the community as a statement that we will get through this and will return. This stadium which is now empty, will soon enough be filled with the Highclimber faithful cheering on our athletes.

This will be the last Friday Night Lights that these lights will ever shine on this field. In the short few months ahead, we will have new lights, a new field, and a new future. However, we will not forget this moment in time or our Seniors lost seasons.

Tonight those lights will be burning for you Seniors, and the community which we love.

Sincerely,
Trevor Leopold

We are very proud to announce that Shelton School District has been named to CollegeBoard’s AP® District Honor Roll!

Shelton School District is one of 250 school districts in the U.S. and Canada being honored by the College Board with placement on the 10th Annual AP® District Honor Roll. To be included on the 10th Annual Honor Roll, Shelton School District had to, since 2017, increase the number of students participating in AP while also increasing or maintaining the percentage of students earning AP Exam scores of 3 or higher. Reaching these goals shows that this district is successfully identifying motivated, academically prepared students who are ready for AP. We are #SheltonProud!

“We as a school district are very proud of this outstanding achievement. I congratulate the efforts of our students, staff, and the support of our parents and families. Shelton proud, Shelton now!” - Superintendent, Dr. Apostle

Shelton School District students recently went to the first Native American Youth Leadership Academy (NAYLA) meeting of the year. The NAYLA program is geared to help gather Native American youth from across the Western Washington region. It develops leadership, communication, and life skills for Native youth in a safe and nurturing environment. These students, that represent many districts, gather and discuss topics that affect their lives and how to approach solving issues. Along with making new friends and stepping out of their comfort zones, students learn to become leaders in their schools, among their peers, and in their communities.

For more information visit https://www.sheltonschools.org/cms/One.aspx?portalId=16522521&pageId=24313954.

Santa came early to the Shelton School District! We received three donations totaling $8,211 that will go towards any debt accumulated prior to families qualifying for the free/reduced meal program! This is a huge relief for those families during the holiday season.

There are parents out there that are struggling trying to make ends meet and I hope that this will take some stress off their shoulders. Maybe they can put some of the money they were going to put toward these meal charges and buy a nice Thanksgiving or Christmas meal for their family or maybe a present under the tree for their kids. Have a Merry Christmas and enjoy your lunches! ” - Secret Santa

The Shelton School District cannot thank these donors enough for their extraordinary generosity in helping make our families’ holiday season much brighter. ❤️

We hope everyone had a blast at the 38th Annual Oysterfest! 🎉
OysterFest is put on by the Skookum Rotary Club of Shelton, WA the first weekend in October every year. It is dedicated to nonprofit organizations from Mason County only with all proceeds going back into Mason County. Shelton School District has provided student volunteers for that last four years to help set up, work over the weekend and tear down after the event. This year we had around 100 student volunteers from the district! From Cheerleaders, Robotics, Dance team to ROTC, students put in a lot of work and effort to make this year’s event a success. We are #SheltonProud!
